visualization_prompt: Generate an area chart showing value thresholds using color zones with Highcharts, incorporating axis inversion and reversal configurations.
visualization_explanation:
The dataset contains an 8-point univariate time series demonstrating value thresholds. Synthetic data follows a multimodal distribution with peaks at 1 and 3, intentionally creating crossing points at the zone threshold (value=1). Data quality is artificially constructed to test axis inversion logic.

The area chart maximizes data-ink ratio by removing legend and markers while using stark color zones for immediate threshold recognition. Zone coloring follows Cairo's preattentive processing principles for instant pattern detection. Axis reversal tests perceptual consistency in inverted coordinate space. Value distribution (μ=1.45, σ=1.12) creates intentional overlap at the threshold to validate zone rendering.
